_header: Now fair fairest of every fair
Subjects: occasional verse; political verse; Margaret, queen of Scotland
_description: William Dunbar, To the Princess Margaret on her arrival at Holyrood, A.D. 1503 — seventeen lines

BLRoyApp58.First Lines:
Now fayre fayrest off euery fayreprinces most plesant and
                    preclare[?]…
BLRoyApp58.Last Lines:
…welcum the rose bothe rede & whytewelcum the floure of
                    oure delyteoure secrete reioysyng frome the son bemewelcum of
                    sotlond to be quenewelcum of scotlonde to be quene
